Only text: 'Why output dominates'.
rubric: The slide uses a clean, technical diagram style with deadpan humor.
Title text reads exactly 'Why output dominates'.
No extra text appears beyond the specified labels.
Output tokens are shown going through repeated compute blocks sequentially.
Input appears processed once while output repeats many steps.

failures: The slide contains extra text beyond the specified labels: 'Input', 'Compute', and multiple 'Output' labels appear even though the prompt says the only text should be 'Why output dominates'.

improvements: Remove all text from within the blocks so that the only text on the slide is the title 'Why output dominates'. Use icons, shapes, or unlabeled blocks to represent input, compute, and output tokens while keeping the sequential structure.

grade.summary: Visual style and structural logic match the requested concept (one input compute vs. many repeated output computes), but the presence of additional labels like 'Input', 'Compute', and 'Output' violates the requirement that the only text on the slide be the title 'Why output dominates', so the slide does not pass.
